body: Let me find a different way. Changing cursor while keeping emacs shortcut.
I was hoping I had more time to refactor some other streams usage but, for now, just created this pull request for the missing close stream in Helium. Any questions, please let me know. Thanks.
LGTM and merge to master if no further comment.

To summarize, es-hadoop is aware that from command line, non spark.* parameters get ignored so they created a workaround to allow setting the parameters through spark.es.* parameters. 
Either way, as I suspected, the parameters themselves are serialized separately to the executors and not through the spark configuration.
I must say that I still think that blocking any non-spark configuration settings is overprotective relative to what you can perform in code, but I am no longer blocked by this issue.

Hi guys,
i'm still waiting an answer, maybe there is no interest to this PR, it's ok for me but just give me some feedback. Sorry if i bother you but I need this with the Neo4jIntepreter for a small PoC that i have to develop so I need infos in order to plan my work. 
Thanks
Thanks @orenpai for clarify. I won't revert this PR as even I revert this PR, non-spark configuration still won't be propagated to executor, this is due to spark not zeppelin.

Thanks for the great work @soralee! And also thanks for detailed review @1ambda. Tested and looks nice! I really like the most of parts. Some minor suggestion is #### Technologies - how about using same border color with "Deployment" box `#999` instead of `#4881B3`? #### Deployment - how about putting "LEARN MORE" buttons in each deployment section box in the middle instead of right side? - and also we can remove the single & multi user font awesome icons since the text ("single" and "multi") itself already explain what "single-user" and "multi-user" are meaning for. How about this? It's just my opinion. Please have a look and feel free to share your thought :)

@zjffdu Unit test merged and the traceback msg concatenated to one string.  

During CI testing, the third one would fail randomly with the following error:

ParagraphActionsIT.testSingleDynamicFormTextInput:554->AbstractZeppelinIT.waitForParagraph:68->AbstractZeppelinIT.pollingWait:94 Â» Timeout

Sometimes, rerun the test  or just do some minor syntax change can pass the third CI. 
I have no idea why this would happen. The error message seems to be complaining wait timeout during spark test which had nothing to do with the code I changed.

It's not a strong opinion, but how about make `api/version` return version and git hash instead of add new api endpoint `api/git`? I think commit hash and timestamp can be part of version information. What do you think?
@tinkoff-dwh Let me take a look!
Finally pass the CI. @zjffdu I have updated the screen shot and could you share any light on why CI would fail randomly?
Thanks @qwemicheal , What is the failed test you see ? If it is not in the livy component, then it is most likely flaky test.

@zjffdu The failure most often happen on the third one of Travis CI , sometimes the second one or ninth one. I have checked the error log multiple times and they all have nothing to do with the Livy code I modified. Most of the time just rerun the failed test can then pass. However, the pass statue won't get updated on PR page so I have to trigger the CI again. Do you have any better way to deal with random failure on CI?

This PR limit the output of paragraph in web, however it also limit the max download lines.

My suggestion is to limit output of paragraph through zeppelin.interpreter.output.limit and limit the number of download lines through common.max_count.

@AhyoungRyu I updated as your mentions.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8110458/26912241-117e2a68-4c4e-11e7-9827-6ee01e514ad3.png)
Thanks @qwemicheal , will merge it if no more comments.
Thanks for the feedback @Leemoonsoo. Yes, I was 50-50 on having a new API or reusing the "version" one. I'll go with your suggestion and refactor this later this week. Thanks!
to be 100% sure to close properly the stream the `close` method should be called within a `finally` statement of a `try`

@andreaTP  try() doesn't call close when it occurs exception?

`try-with-resources` is used only for `InputStream` here.
there is nothing on outputstream.
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/tryResourceClose.html
Let me check. Thanks for the contribution and great effort on the improving official website.
@andreaTP Thanks for fixing it. I've missed it. BTW, I think we'd better use try-with-resources of outputStream
Thanks, Will merge it after CI become green

## 6. font-size, text-shadow for menus in the navbar including collapsed version.

### 6-1 normal version

Since the toplevel menu's font-size is `15px`, sub menus should have the equal or less font-size. currently, it's `16px`. 

- Let's set font-size `15px` for `.docs .dropdown-menu li span`

#### Current

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4968473/26961495-1333e754-4d1a-11e7-816f-e48c1d5c0622.png)

#### Fixed

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4968473/26961501-21c830c2-4d1a-11e7-8006-c68edf5dd50d.png)

### 6-2 collapsed version

- `text-shadow` in the sub menus can be decreased. too much IMO:  from `1px 2px #353131` to `1px 1px #353131`
- for `font-size`, we can apply the same policy with **6-1**
  * `15px` for `.navbar-inverse .navbar-nav > li > a ` (in all media queries for the collapsed version  just not for `@media only screen and (max-width: 996px) and (min-width: 768px)`
  * `15px` for `.docs .dropdown-menu b` (in all media queries  for the collapsed version )
  * `14px` for `.navbar-nav .open .dropdown-menu` (for all  for the collapsed version)
  * fix padding-bottom for `.docs .dropdown-menu li span` from `12px 10px 12px 20px` to `12px 10px 12px 15px`. Currently it's too close to children.
 
#### Current

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4968473/26961635-3b6aaa7c-4d1b-11e7-924e-2f072309e5b2.png)

#### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4968473/26961687-a732309a-4d1b-11e7-98b0-97150a99fc8e.png)

It turns out that the Pac4JPrincipal provided by buji is returning CommonProfile.getId() and not the getUsername() or getDisplayName() values for getName(). https://github.com/bujiio/buji-pac4j/blob/master/src/main/java/io/buji/pac4j/subject/Pac4jPrincipal.java I believe the intent of the Principal.getName() method is to return a human-friendly name, not a computer-friendly identifier. I created an issue on the Buji github project to see if they are open to changing it. https://github.com/bujiio/buji-pac4j/issues/61 On Fri, Jun 9, 2017 at 6:50 AM, Andrea Peruffo wrote: > *@andreaTP* commented on this pull request. > ------------------------------ > > In zeppelin-web/src/components/navbar/navbar.html > : > > > @@ -86,7 +86,7 @@ > uib-tooltip="WebSocket Disconnected" tooltip-placement="bottom" style="margin-top: 7px; vertical-align: top"> >
Thank you guys now I'll proceed with the second part of the original PR. The Neo4j's interpreter:)

Thanks for contribution. I suggest you'd better divide this PR into three or more different PRs as you mentioned in description. This PR includes many changes. I hope every PR changes as small as possible. Can you do that? And there's no test. If you add some tests, it makes your implementation concrete and easy to understand what you want to change.

Thanks. Merge it if there's no more discussion.

Just as a note, I pushed and reverted a commit on a bit of code that confused me. Looks that the npm package always needs to have root folder name "package". I'm keeping that logic.
Hi, It's intended behaviours. If you want to restart your interpreter only, you can click the restart button on the note page.

@zjffdu In case of Spark, you're so true. But as I mentioned it before, it's for all interpreters including python and so on. I think if we finish ZEPPELIN-2035, we improve spark's way of running interpreter. It will be a definitely better idea to use Spark's native way.
And it's big change of running interpreters but it rarely affects current code. I divided all cluster manager code into another module to reduce dependencies.

@jongyoul  sorry for vague description,  "his note configuration page" means "note page"; when some one restart interpreter on note page, the running jobs of others  has also been aborted.

@Leemoonsoo I did some experiments to revert the original layout while keeping highlights. But I think it takes a time to fix. So here are few options. 

(A) revert 2356 and then reimplement the highlighting line feature considering original layout later.
(B) keep current layout and refine designs so that new layout goes along with other components.

And #2386 is for `(B)` while fixing some bugs. Could you take a look (consider) `B` as well?
